name: 3-bromo-5-(trifluoromethyl)pyridine

The introduction of a bromine atom to the pyridine ring would likely increase the melting point due to its larger atomic size and ability to participate in intermolecular interactions (+50°C). The trifluoromethyl group is an electron-withdrawing group and has a significant inductive effect that could increase intermolecular interactions due to its three highly electronegative fluorine atoms (+40°C). The cumulative effect of adding these functional groups to the pyridine would result in an overall increase in the melting point.
